title: Meta: I'm Not Sweating A Drop After The Post Q3 Earnings Selloff
text: I see a market overreaction. Despite 26% YoY revenue growth to $51.24B, rising ad KPIs, and strong OCF, META sold off, leaving it the cheapest hyperscaler at ~25.6x forward P/E. The selloff stems from capex and buybacks: 2025 capex was raised to $70-$72B with an even bigger 2026 step-up, and buybacks slowed (none in September), signaling cash prioritization for infrastructure. Fundamentals look solid: $79.6B OCF in 9M 2025 (+26% YoY) with $48.3B capex (61% of OCF). Ads up 26%, with the Street expecting >20% growth in the next two quarters.
